Name: Name
PlaylistNameTooShort: Playlist name must be at least 2 characters
PlaylistNameFavoritesReserved: Playlist name cannot be a reserved system name
PlaylistNameAlreadyExists: A Playlist with this name already exists
SyncLibraryToolTip: Scan all music library to synchronize new songs and changes to existing songs
ScanInProgressDetails: A library scan is already running. Please wait for it to complete.
ScanCompletedDetails: Music library has been synchronized successfully
ClearLibraryToolTip: Remove all music and data from the database
ClearLibraryConfirmMessage:
This will permanently delete all music data from all profiles, including:

• Songs, Albums, Artists, Playlists, Genres and Folders 
• Play history and Favorites

All profiles and settings will be preserved.

This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to continue?
StartingCleanupDetails: Removing all music data while preserving profiles and settings...
CleanupCompletedDetails: All music and data has been removed. Profiles and settings have been preserved.
QueueClearedDeletedDirectory_Title: Queue cleared due to removed directory
QueueClearedDeletedDirectory_Message: Queue and playback were cleared because there were tracks from a directory deleted or blacklisted
ApiIntegrationToolTip: Enable automatic fetching of artist photos from Deezer API. When disabled, only photos already fetched or set manually will be used.
DynamicPauseToolTip: Automatically Pause when any external audio is detected on the device
AddLanguageInstructions: *To add a new Language, access: {0}, make a copy of any .json file, change the copy's values as desired and restart the app.
ClearQueueMessage: Are you sure you want to clear the entire Now Playing Queue?
QueueClearedMessage: The Now Playing queue has been cleared.
PleaseWaitInitializing: Initializing Omega Music Player, please wait...
ChooseYourPreferredLanguage: Choose your preferred language for the application.
ChooseYourPreferredTheme: Choose your preferred theme for the application.
EnterYourProfileName: Enter a name for your profile. You can create additional profiles later.
SelectFoldersContainingMusic: Select the folders where your music is stored. You can add more folders later.
NoFoldersSelected: No music folders selected. Please add at least one folder to continue.
ProfileLimitReachedSecondHalf: . Delete a profile to create a new one.
ProfileNameTooShort: Profile name must be at least 2 characters
ProfileNameSystemReserved: Profile name cannot be a reserved system name
ProfileNameAlreadyExists: A profile with this name already exists
LoadDefaultState: Loading application to default state due to unexpected error
ErrorRemovingTracksFromNowPlaying: Error Removing songs from now playing queue
ErrorAddingPlayNext: Error Adding songs to play next
ThemeRecoveryFailed: Unable to apply theme after multiple attempts
ErrorNavigatingToItem: Error Navigating to selected search item
ErrorAddingToQueue: Error Adding songs to play next
ErrorLoadingTracksDetails: We couldn't load your music. Please check your library folders and try again.
UnhandledExceptionTerminatingDetails: A critical error occurred that may cause the application to terminate.
UnhandledExceptionHandledDetails: An unexpected error occurred that was handled automatically.
DatabaseInitializationFailed: Music database could not be initialized
ProfileInitializationFailed: User profile could not be loaded
ThemeInitializationFailed: Theme settings could not be loaded
DatabaseError_NetworkDownload_Message: OmegaMusicPlayer couldn't download the required database components. This usually indicates a network connectivity issue.
DatabaseError_Permissions_Message: OmegaMusicPlayer doesn't have the required permissions to set up the database. This commonly happens with restricted user accounts.
DatabaseError_Locale_Message: The database couldn't initialize due to system locale settings. This can happen on systems with non-standard language configurations.
DatabaseError_Dependencies_Message: OmegaMusicPlayer requires certain system components that appear to be missing from your computer.
DatabaseError_Security_Message: Your antivirus or security software may be preventing OmegaMusicPlayer from setting up the database.
DatabaseError_DiskSpace_Message: OmegaMusicPlayer needs at least 500 MB of free space, but only {0} MB is available.
DatabaseError_PortConflict_Message: The database server couldn't start due to a port conflict with another application.
DatabaseError_ProcessFailure_Message: The database server process couldn't start properly. This might be due to system resources or conflicting software.
DatabaseError_PathCharacters_Message: The database setup path contains characters that aren't supported. This can happen with special characters in folder names.
DatabaseError_InvalidPathCharacters_Mess: The installation path contains characters that may cause problems.
DatabaseError_Unknown_Message: An unexpected error occurred while setting up the database.
Troubleshoot_CheckOrganizationBlocks: Check if your organization blocks downloads
Troubleshoot_RestartComputer: Restart your computer and try again
Troubleshoot_CheckPermissions: Right-click OmegaMusicPlayer and select 'Run as administrator'
Troubleshoot_CheckAppDataPermissions: Ensure your user account has full control over the AppData folder
Troubleshoot_CheckOtherPrograms: Check that no other program is using the database folder
Troubleshoot_DisableFolderProtection: Temporarily disable any folder protection software
Troubleshoot_ContactAdmin: Contact your system administrator if on a managed computer
Troubleshoot_CheckLocale: Ensure your system has a valid locale setting
Troubleshoot_CheckRegionSettings: In Windows, check Region settings in Control Panel
Troubleshoot_ChangeLocaleTemporary: Try changing your system locale to English (US) temporarily
Troubleshoot_RestartAfterLocale: Restart OmegaMusicPlayer after changing locale settings
Troubleshoot_AddToExclusions: Add OmegaMusicPlayer to your antivirus exclusions list
Troubleshoot_AddFolderToDefender: Add the OmegaMusicPlayer installation folder to Windows Defender exclusions
Troubleshoot_CheckSmartScreen: Check if Windows SmartScreen is blocking the application
Troubleshoot_DisableAntivirusTemporary: Try running with antivirus completely disabled (temporarily)
Troubleshoot_InstallVCRedist: Install Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2013
Troubleshoot_InstallNetFramework: Download and install .NET Framework 4.8 or later
Troubleshoot_RestartAfterInstall: Restart your computer after installing components
Troubleshoot_CheckUsername: Ensure your username doesn't contain special characters
Troubleshoot_AvoidSpecialChars: Avoid installing in folders with non-English characters
Troubleshoot_TrySimplePath: Try moving OmegaMusicPlayer to a simple path like C:\Program Files\OmegaMusicPlayer
Troubleshoot_CheckAppDataPath: Check that your AppData folder path is valid
Troubleshoot_RestartAndRetry: Restart your computer and try again
Troubleshoot_CheckPortAvailability: Check if there is any port between 15432 and 15500 available, in case all are used consider freeing one of them
Troubleshoot_FreeDiskSpace: Free up disk space by deleting unnecessary files
Troubleshoot_MoveLargeFiles: Move large files to another drive
Troubleshoot_CheckFolderPermissions: Check folder permissions in File Explorer
Troubleshoot_CheckAntivirus: Ensure antivirus isn't blocking file creation
Troubleshoot_CheckEventLog: Check Windows Event Log for additional errors
MediaDirectory_CreationFailed_Message: Failed to create required media directories. Please ensure the application has write permissions to its installation folder.
PreFlight_Failed_Message: Unable to verify system requirements for database setup.
OmegaMusicPlayerAlreadyRunning_Title: Omega Music Player is already running
OmegaMusicPlayerAlreadyRunning_Message:
Another instance of Omega Music Player was detected.

Please check your taskbar.
Troubleshoot_OmegaMusicPlayerAlreadyRunn: Always keep only one instance of Omega Music Player open, if you see this message but don't see application, open your Task Manager and kill all Omega Music Player instances, then try to open it again.
DatabaseError_CorruptedBinaries_Message: The PostgreSQL database files appear to be corrupted and cannot be executed.
DatabaseError_BinaryValidation_Message: The database components could not be validated or are not functional.
Troubleshoot_DeleteAppDataFolder: Delete the OmegaMusicPlayer folder in AppData and restart
Troubleshoot_ReinstallFromFreshDownload: Reinstall OmegaMusicPlayer from a fresh download
Troubleshoot_CheckAppDataNotProtected: Check that AppData folder is not protected
